intro: Leiospermum parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered starling plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Leiospermum parviflorum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
